title: Gijinka Challenge
body:
Yooo- I made a Discord where you can draw daily pokemon in gijinka form. Though other kinds of gijinkas can be included if suggested.

Here’s a link:
discord.gg/Efawshz

You’ll be a traveler until you either comment that you’d like to be a challenger or message me on my discord at SketchyOh#4132 about becoming a challenger.

There’s not much to explain cause it’s just a chat where you can discuss designs and join the daily challenge.

There’s just me and another friend so far but feel free to join!

tags: i know this makes no sense but i had to get it out there
summary: Why Sinnoh should have been the series tie-in to Mega Evolution: A Discourse
body:
Why Sinnoh should have been the series tie-in to Mega Evolution: A Discourse

I’m sitting here silently fuming right now due to the realization I’m about to lay down. I’ll start with the key point: Sinnoh should have been used as the mega evolution tie-in remake, not ORAS.

Okay, hear me out. (This is gonna be a long one, so buckle up)

I’m playing through Pokemon Pearl for the first time (I know I know I’m a monster), and I just got through the first gym, where you encounter Team Galactic for the first time. They want to steal Prof. Rowan’s research on Pokemon evolution. That he just got back to Sinnoh with after traveling abroad to study… This ringing any bells? This is perfectly explained if Rowan just got back from Kalos where he learned of mega evolution while working with Sycamore.

Rowan could be responsible for spreading the knowledge and hype of mega evolution through Sinnoh, having more trainers with mega stones and mega Pokemon later in your journey for the difficulty ramp up.

Now wait a second, you’re saying. Aren’t mega stones and key stones rather rare to come by? And to that I say, yes. But what if I told you that a veritable gold mine of mega treasures lay beneath the feet of the people of sinnoh? That’s right, the Underground is the perfect place to reward trainers’ exploration with mega stones. Can you imagine how cool it would have been to find your own key stone in the Underground??

But then what could Team Galactic want with mega evolution? I say this would have been there perfect opportunity to tie mega forms into the Sinnoh legendaries. Giratina already has two forms. Why not the others? Or what if the lake trio had hidden forms dormant that were unlocked with the power of a mega stone? I bet Galactic would be salivating to get their hands on that kind of power.

But what about Groudon and Kyogre’s primal forms? Aren’t they mega evolution? Mm, not quite, and here’s where I want the separation between ORAS and Sinnoh to happen. Mega Evolution and Primal Forms are separate and distinct evolutionary mechanisms, and in being separate, ORAS would not have to be divorced from RSE’s timeline in such a drastic way. The introduction of mega evolution to other regions is naturally done over time by Rowan, so a Hoenn remake with mega evolution would make sense being in the future, and not just a parallel universe where mega Evo exists. (And I’m throwing the garbage that was the Delta episode in the trash)

BECAUSE

The ORAS games would focus on the phenomenon of Primal Revision, NOT, mega Evo. This would allow Pokemon from up through gen four to have megas in Sinnoh and Hoenn (but to a lesser extent in Hoenn, bc remember, mega evo is hot in Sinnoh, so only certain people would have a mega in Hoenn), but primal revision is a thing which could still make sense in the overall plot of ORAS. Ancient Pokemon, fossils, stones, y'know, all the reasons they shoehorned mega evo into ORAS bc Steven Stone likes stones?

And now I’m just sitting here going “game freak why???” Why didn’t you give us Cynthia and her Mega Garchomp championship battle? Why didn’t you not mess up the entire timeline of the games with some bs about parallel universes when you had an ancient tribe of dragon worshippers to explain their lore about primal reversion and why Rayquaza had an alternate form to stop Groudon and Kyogre those thousands of years ago? Why didn’t you give us the ability to explore fossil pokemon in their original primal context where they could shed the rock typing for more diverse, interesting types? (Oh and the fossil park in Alola could have become so much more with primal reversion as a mechanism for evolution).

I get that this radically alters the specific events of the Sinnoh and ORAS games, but I could absolutely see the same series of events happening in different ways that tie in to the specific events mechanic in each game.

Change my mind.
